title: Clinical Research Associate (Fixed Term) in Immunity and Therapeutics
text:
★ View Employer Profile 
Applications are invited for an academic clinical research fellow in Immunity and Therapeutics at the JDRF/Wellcome Trust Diabetes and Inflammation Laboratory, NIHR Cambridge Biomedical Research Centre, Cambridge Institute for Medical Research, University of Cambridge, UK. The post offers an unrivalled opportunity to join a translational research programme within an outstanding academic and clinical environment. It will provide cutting-edge training for candidates who wish to pursue a career in clinical academic medicine or drug development. The post holder will assist in the development and conduct of novel clinical trials to evaluate interleukin-2 and other potential therapeutic agents for the treatment of type 1 diabetes and other autoimmune disorders. Laboratory-based research will be an integral part of the training. 
Applicants should be medically qualified, have GMC registration, with an interest in autoimmune disease and immunotherapy and be of the standing required for an appropriate honorary contract of service. 
Further information can be found at https://www-gene.cimr.cam.ac.uk/ . 
Interviews will be held during w/c 28 September 2015. 
This appointment also requires an Honorary Clinical Contract. 
The nature of this role means that the successful candidate will also need to undergo a health assessment. 
Fixed-term: The funds for this post are available until 31 March 2016 in the first instance. 
Once an offer of employment has been accepted, the successful candidate will be required to undergo a health assessment. This appointment also requires an Honorary Clinical Contract. 
To apply online for this vacancy and to view further information about the role, please visit: http://www.jobs.cam.ac.uk/job/8096 . This will take you to the role on the University’s Job Opportunities pages. There you will need to click on the 'Apply online' button and register an account with the University's Web Recruitment System (if you have not already) and log in before completing the online application form. 
Informal enquiries can be made to Dr Frank Waldron-Lynch at frank.waldron-lynch@cimr.cam.ac.uk or Professor John Todd at john.todd@cimr.cam.ac.uk 
Please quote reference SE07075 on your application and in any correspondence about this vacancy. 
The University values diversity and is committed to equality of opportunity. 
The University has a responsibility to ensure that all employees are eligible to live and work in the UK. Share this job
